pros: Very open to change and problem solving
cons: Very bad at communicating anything

pros: It’s work and the location is good.
cons: It’s work and the pay is low.

job_title: Network Coordinator in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Very healthy and friendly work environment
cons: No cons. People are super helpful and warm.

pros: Great to work with students
cons: There was no formal training

pros:
The schedule fits right in with your classes as it is another SJC course, and your professor knows all of your academic obligations.
An excellent opportunity for someone who loved freshman math or sophomore music to dive in deeper.
cons: There is a maximum number of hours the college will pay you for each week (currently 11.5 I believe), but often doing the job well requires more. Lab assistants need to set up practica or music assistants need to help students individually. It is hard or impossible to say no as that negatively impacts the class, so you end up having to choose either working for free or not doing everything that should be done.

pros: It offers a nice working environment
cons: It lacks a proper structure

review_title: Alright but not the best student position
pros: Sometimes no one takes the shuttle so unexpected off days
cons: You’re the only driver for the whole school so it’s easy to get burned out. 2-3 hour afternoon shifts over the weekend

pros: Lab director is very organized. Highly recommend.
cons: Strapped for time on other school work with this job.

job_title: Information Systems Manager in Santa Fe, NM
pros: The beautiful campus is very nice and the people are easy to work with.
cons: There is some politics and working with todays youth is not always fun.

review_title: They do not care about their workers
pros: Not much to say really
cons: They mistreat certain employees. And you will find a lot of racism

pros: Culture is just like the college - thoughtful, careful, thorough and real
cons: Can feel small, some politics

review_title: Could be an exceptional place to work...but isn't yet.
pros: There is a strong sense of service and unity amongst staff and faculty when it comes to the overall mission of the college.  Employees are there for the students, who generally seem appreciative of what we do.  Depending upon the department or supervisor (I seriously stress this), employees also have a good amount of weight when it comes to questioning and updating policies and procedures.  There seems to be good decent work/life balance for employees.
cons: Upper management is generally reluctant to change things too quickly, even when needed.  Many employees who should be heard are not, and the wage gap can be rather alarming.  The economic downturn has done a number of the institution, and that is felt most by the staff who probably need pay increases most.  Morale is generally low because of the lack of trust felt by staff towards upper management.  There is little room or budget for professional development or upward mobility, which can lead to a lot of turnover (especially recently).

pros: Very good leadership and lab skills
cons: no cons for St. John's College

review_title: Flexible hours, rewarding but sometimes tiring work.
pros: Really rewarding work to be able to help underclassmen assimilate to the college. Good hours: there are no fixed hours; it really depends on when your residents need you, so you tend to have more work at the beginning of the school year and less as the year goes on.
cons: You live with your residents, so you better not have any quarrels with them. Flexible hours are a double-edged sword. You may find yourself awake at 4 A.M. tending to freshmen with alcohol poisoning. The pay is the same as every other campus job for students. Starting next year, the room and board fee will be cut in half for RAs, but up until this year you had to pay extra for your RA room.

review_title: A wonderful institution with wonderful people but somewhat dysfunctional management with little room for advancement.
pros: A chance to work with wonderful people committed to the mission of the college which anyone interested in education can be proud of. Great benefits and perks. Beautiful campus.
cons: The management is somewhat dysfunctional especially when trying to collaborate across the two campuses, although this has improved recently. As is true of many non-profits politics trumps production sometimes and mentoring and training of staff could be improved. Their is very little room for advancement.

review_title: Difficult campus job, but well worth it
job_title: Assistant Music Teacher in Annapolis, MD
pros:
-Lots of support from faculty
-Opportunities to tutor students (good for those hoping to pursue a career in education)
-Get to set your own office hours/ tutoring session schedule
-You get to revisit the music program! It's even more fun the second time around.
cons:
-The pay is garbage, especially considering the workload, but that's true of any work-study job.
-Students can be flaky or disrespectful on occasion
-Does take up a lot of time, so you need to be good with time management (it's easy for your work/ school/ life balance to get messed up if you don't keep a handle on it)

pros: you get to do the stuff you like doing that is why you are there in the first place. it is a great place to work doing the things. too bad you cannot do it forever and ever!
cons: imean i didnt get paid in gold bullion nor in candy nor unicorns so i guess there's a lot to be desired. in the future, please pay in candy or gold bullion or unicorns or vespas. free the axolotls.

review_title: A good job if you have kids and need a relaxed schedule
job_title: Business Office/Financial Aid in Annapolis, MD
pros: Great working hours (35 hours per week) and benefits.
cons: Little control over management; many abusive middle managers and not protections for those under them.  Morale is not the best.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Laid back workspace that rarely gets tense. Co-workers are mostly chill and are often fun to talk to.
cons: The management and administration is horrendous. There is very little communication between the different departments which makes everyones lives difficult and everybody ends up hating one another.

review_title: Disappointing.  I thought I would enjoy working in a small collegiate enviornment.
job_title: Prefer Not to Answer in Annapolis, MD
pros: The work can be challenging; however, the senior leadership is completely dysfunctional.  I find that it can be a hot bed of gossip and this is extremely unpleasant for someone who craves professionalism.
cons: Please see what is written above.

job_title: Student Worker in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Its a great student job for work study, and you can refine you teaching/coaching skills with a population that is relatively untrained.
cons:
Largely inactive student population that makes the classes not well attended; Crochety old people who don't like you teaching in 'their gym". 

It's also a Work Study job, so you might run out of money before the semester's end depending on how many hours you coach.

review_title: Resident Assistant job for Junior and Senior year
pros: The weekly meetings were good discussions with fellow students about student well-being, and I thought they were interesting and informative. The administration is generally very accessible if you have any problems with your hall.
cons: Balancing your friendships with people you RA for versus your responsibility as a "school employee" was always unclear and sometimes frustrating and confusing.

pros: The supervisors are friendly and take care of the student aides by assigning reasonable amount of workload, and talking to you before changing schedules. Easy work-life balance. They are helpful in terms of giving feedback to performance, and giving clear instructions.
cons: Things are running slowly and steadily with little change.

review_title: Things are on the up swing
pros: Great faculty and staff. Close-knit community. Unique purpose and learning environment. Beautiful campus. Great location. New president knows his stuff.
cons: Low pay. Lots of politics. High turnover.

job_title: Executive Assistant in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Helping students and supporting the great books program
cons: Staff are overworked and underpaid. Constant fear that the Santa Fe campus is a sinking ship and will get closed down. No raises and minuscule opportunities for advancement.

job_title: Writing Assistant in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Great flexibility with individual schedules, excellent training and supervision, fulfilling work, enjoyable coworkers, depending on whom they are.
cons: Hours most effective for the students are often late at night during the weekend or on weeknights, pay is relatively low.

pros: -Good for someone who wants to be a part of a close community as everyone knows everyone
cons: -There might be some pressure at times as you are given a lot of important responsibilities

review_title: Great books, great education, great work study experience.

pros: Flexible work schedule.  Great environment, really nice full time staff.
cons: Limited work hours through financial aid.

pros: Definitely the hours.  For most employees it is a 35 hour work week.  Which unfortunately can be a very long 35 hours if you are unhappy.
cons: The CFO is controlling and nasty.  If you haven't been there 25 years...move on.
